_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Executive Summary



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:

- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Aslan Cold Storage Reedley has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1 Aslan Cold Storage Reedley, Risk and Process Safety Management Program



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Aslan Cold Storage Reedley has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Process Name               | Process Chemical              | Process Quantity(lbs.)

Process 1                    Anhydrous Ammonia               22,000

Process 2                    Anhydrous Ammonia                7,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.

1. Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and publi

c safety. We have: 

2. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

3. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices



Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.



1.2 Process Descriptions



Aslan Cold Storage Reedley operates a commercial cold storage for a variety of fruit in Reedley, CA. The facility has two ammonia refrigeration systems that provide refrigeration capacity to the following:



Process 1

(3) Rooms

(2) Precools

(1) Shipping Dock



Process 2

(3) Rooms

(1) Precool



The refrigerated spaces are equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation. The only exception is Room 5 which is equipped with air-cooling evaporators and liquid recirculator as required for a pumped overfeed operation.



Most control valve groups are located on the roof to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within or directly adjacent to each machinery room. A partial list of system components includes:



P1 Machinery Room

(3) Screw compressors

(3) Oil separators

(1) Shell and tube oil cooler

(1) High pressure receiver

(1) Liquid transfer vessel

(1) Main suction accumulator

(1) Thermosyphon vessel



Condenser Area

(1) Evaporative condenser

(1) Diffusion tank



Shipping Dock

(2) Air-cooling evaporators (ceiling-suspended)



Room 1

(1) Accumulator

(4) Air-cooling evaporators (bunker-mounted, spiral fin)



Room 3

(1) Accumulator

(4) Air-cooling evaporators (bunker-mounted, spiral fin)



Room 4

(1) Accumulator

(4) Air-cooling evaporators (bunker-mounted, spiral fin)



Precool 1 East

(1) Accumulator

(4) Air-cooling evaporators (bunker-mounted, spiral fin)



Precool 1 West

(1) Accumulator

(4) Ai

r-cooling evaporators (bunker-mounted, spiral fin)



Precool 2 East

(1) Accumulator

(2) Air-cooling evaporators (bunker-mounted, spiral fin)



Precool 2 West

(1) Accumulator

(4) Air-cooling evaporators (bunker-mounted, spiral fin)



P2 Machinery Room

(1) Reciprocating compressor

(2) Screw compressors

(3) Oil separators

(2) Shell and tube oil cooler (water-cooled)

(1) Liquid recirculator

(1) Oil pot

(2) Ammonia pumps

(1) Accumulator (for Room 7)



Condenser Area

(1) High pressure receiver

(1) Liquid transfer vessel

(1) Main suction accumulator

(1) Evaporative condenser



Diffusion Tank Area

(1) Diffusion tank



Room 5

(6) Air-cooling evaporators (ceiling-suspended)



Room 6

(1) Accumulator

(3) Air-cooling evaporators (bunker-mounted, plate fin)



Room 7

(1) Air-cooling evaporator (bunker-mounted, plate fin)



Precool 3

(1) Accumulator

(3) Air-cooling evaporators (bunker-mounted, plate fin)



The flooded system operates as follows: high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped to each cold room, where it passes through an expansion valve into low temperature and pressure accumulator mounted behind the bunker wall. From the accumulators, low pressure liquid is circulated through evaporator coils. As heat is absorbed, the liquid ammonia vaporizes to form low temperature and pressure gas which is returned to the accumulator vessels. The suction gas is returned from the accumulators through a suction return line to the main suction accumulator.  From the main suction accumulator, ammonia is piped to the suction inlet on the compressors. The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to water-cooled evaporative condensers where the high pressure gas ammonia is cooled, liquefied and returned to the thermosyphon vessel and then to the high pressure receiver.



The pumped overfeed system (Room 5 only) operates as follows:  high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped through a series of liquid feed s

olenoid valves, an expansion valve, and into a liquid recirculator.  From there, low pressure liquid is pumped to each evaporator, where it passes through a solenoid valve, hand expansion valve and into evaporator.  Low temperature liquid circulates through the evaporator.  As heat is absorbed, the liquid ammonia vaporizes to form low temperature and pressure gas which passes through an isolation valve and is returned to the liquid recirculator.  The residual liquid is separated from the gas in the recirculator and the gas is piped to the suction inlet on the compressors which elevate the temperature and pressure of the gas.  The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to a water cooled evaporative condenser where the high pressure gas ammonia is liquefied and returned to the high pressure receiver.



The system contains numerous safety devices including sensors which stop the compressors if temperatures or pressures exceed or drop below established limits, and pressure relief valves which vent to the atmosphere if the pressure in the system exceeds their set point. 



There is an ammonia detector installed inside P1 and P2 machinery room, Room 5, Room 6, Room 7, and Precool 3. Each sensor is set at the California OSHA permissible exposure limit of 25 ppm, which will activate an audible alarm and notify plant personnel. Also, a sampling system is installed in each refrigerated area (P1 only) that provides at least every 15-minute interval monitoring. The sampling system is set at the California OSHA permissible exposure limit of 25 ppm, which will activate an audible alarm and initiate an auto-dialer.



An emergency control box is installed on the south exterior wall of P1 refrigeration machinery room, which contains three valves. The high and low side of the system each have a valve that would discharge to the diffusion tank. The connecting pipe between the high and low side has one equalizer valve that would equalize the system.



Each ammonia ref

rigeration system at Aslan Cold Storage Reedley consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping.  As such, each refrigeration system at Aslan Cold Storage Reedley is treated as a single process.



1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



1.3.1 General 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



Aslan Cold Storage Reedley has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 



1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia



The ammonia refrigeration process at the Aslan Cold Storage Reedley facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia processes contain a total charge of approximately 29,000 lbs. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.



Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 



1.4 Five Year Accident History



Aslan Cold Storage Reedley has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.



1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan



Aslan Cold Storage Reedley's emergency action and response pr

ogram has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

- California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

- Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38 



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Aslan Cold Storage Reedley has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Aslan Cold Storage Reedley continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Aslan Cold Storage Reedley's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Aslan Cold Storage Reedley's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Aslan Cold Storage Reedley has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Aslan Cold Storage Reedley has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help

with RMP-PSM program implementation.



For the future, Aslan Cold Storage Reedley now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Aslan Cold Storage Reedley employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Aslan Cold Storage Reedley will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
